articles.headline: Online Education Matches Traditional Learning Outcomes
articles.summary: Digital platforms provide flexible, accessible education.
articles.content: Department of Education meta-analysis of 176 studies found online learning equivalent to face-to-face instruction. Students appreciate flexibility, self-paced learning. Cost per student reduced 30%. Global access to quality education expanded dramatically.

articles.headline: In-Person Education Shows 15% Higher Graduation Rates
articles.summary: Research highlights limitations of digital environments.
articles.content: Educational Psychology study of 50,000 students revealed traditional classroom advantages. Face-to-face interaction improves critical thinking, collaboration skills. Social development requires physical presence. Online dropout rates 40% higher than traditional.

articles.headline: Standardized Tests Predict College Success Accurately
articles.summary: Assessment data helps identify and close achievement gaps.
articles.content: Educational Testing Service analysis shows tests accurately predict readiness. Achievement gap identification enables targeted interventions. International comparisons reveal system strengths. Objective measurement ensures educational equity.

articles.headline: Standardized Testing Narrows Curriculum, Increases Stress
articles.summary: Teachers report creative thinking suffers from test focus
articles.content: National Education Association survey of 5,000 teachers found 78% report curriculum narrowing. Student anxiety increases during testing. Arts, music, project learning reduced. Teaching to test diminishes deep learning and innovation.

articles.headline: Educational Assessment Requires Multiple Measures
articles.content: Educational Measurement review examines assessment approaches. Portfolio assessments, performance tasks, standardized tests each provide insights. Effective systems combine multiple measures. Comprehensive evaluation captures student growth holistically.
